title: Typo in the `_mm256_mullo_epi32` documentation
body:
When working with SIMD intrinsics, I noticed that the `_mm256_mullo_epi32` function's documentation has a typo in it that confused me. Here is the documentation in question (for both `core::arch::x86` and `core::arch::x86_64`):

> Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and return the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers

Links: [x86](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.29.1/core/arch/x86/fn._mm256_mullo_epi32.html) and [x86_64](https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.29.1/core/arch/x86_64/fn._mm256_mullo_epi32.html)

Looking at the linked Intel documentation [here](https://software.intel.com/sites/landingpage/IntrinsicsGuide/#text=_mm256_mullo_epi32&expand=4002), it says that the low 32 bits are returned, instead of the low 16 bits:

> Multiply the packed signed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.

I also double checked that the Rust implementation is correct (and the documentation is wrong) in the playground [here](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=69276d4b3466a1b2ff2170dfe5e800b9).

This should be an easy fix by replacing both occurrences of the documentation with:
> Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and return the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers

Note that the SSE version of the intrinsic is properly documented.
